WRITING.TITLE: Hit a wall at rank 3 need some advice.
WRITING.TEXT: I went from rank 10 to 5 with N'zoth renolock and continued the climbing with dragon priest but hit a wall at rank 3, renolocks are just stomping me, and pirate warrior don't let me tech in greedy cards.. I know that is an unfavored match up, but some advice could help please :(

WRITING.TITLE: "Eye-hand Tree" By Solne Azernour, Digital Painting, 2014.

WRITING.TEXT: I tried both DP and HN and found more useful and versatile HN, some times the healing + Northshire cleric saved my ass.. but it's true that depends on the meta you are facing.. sometime DP or lightbomb are going to be better.
Seppuku time :(
Seppuku?
Dr. Boom, Malganis, Sludge Belcher and Light Bomb.. oh and Deathlord too.. also hate the pirate cannons is disgusting the combo in wild pirate warrior.

Also you need to now when use aoe, or how to tech in cards vs control or vs aggro like pint potion, argus, twilight drakes etc... pirate warrior doesn't tech a shit because always goes face, even kolento said on stream that dragon priest isn't obviously the hardest deck to play but at least it require some skill or mastering has its merit.
I swear if the chimpanzee get to legend I'll quit hearthstone.

Because hearthstone have history with 1 drops: "tunnel trogg, cogmaster, undertaker etc".. they now that 1 drops can break the game and they just don't give a fuck about that, we are not the responsables of balancing or seen if cards will be broken or not, they are supposed to have a team of pros on the subject to do that :/
There were some descent budget lists that worked pretty well, C'thun druid also was expensive you neded fandral and twin emperor, some list even included mulch :/

I had the same problem as you and the only solution I could think of was never accepting a friend request if I don't know that guy, I come to hearthstone to have fun, not to get mad, salty and flamed, is sad but it is what it is..
C'thun warrior was more like control warrior and you didn't play on curve with that deck, I think you are talking about the old c'thun druid..

The thing is that they didn't need to test STB, only looking at the card you can tell that it was broken.. they do this all the time with 1 drops, I think maybe its on porpoise, it doesn't have sense :S

You can taste the meta whith decks like dragon priest, pirate warrior, water rogue, midrange shaman, reno priest or reno warlock the core deck of the first I named you are almost the same as standard list.. and if you find that you like wild, later you can craft belcher, zombie chow or piloted shredders.. take a look of the snapshot and maybe you can find some inspiration there ;)
